main event: On 14 September 1958, Captain Murphy and his family observed an object the size and brilliance of Mars traveling rapidly at a high altitude to the northeast over Baileys Bay, Bermuda.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 5 to 6 minutes before it disappeared,No sound was heard during the sighting,The object's speed was described as very rapid,The sighting occurred in the evening local time,The report speculated that the object might have been Sputnik III but lacked confirmation.
sighted object: An object the size and brilliance of Mars
witness description: Captain Murphy and 4 members of his family
